items.title: PHP developer at WealthConductor LLC () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Industry: Financial Services, Financial Technology
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job description

We are looking for a contract developer with the ability and experience to implement a variety of integrations with select partners of the company. Our customers’ #1 wish for our platform is to integrate with their preferred software vendors. Our primary bottleneck in that effort is developer bandwidth, so we need your help writing the code that transforms our partners’ data into data that our system can understand.

This position is 100% remote, but you must be able to overlap regularly with business hours in the US Eastern time zone. The estimated weekly effort is a minimum of 10 hours, which will increase with demonstrated success; pay will be on an hourly basis.

Skills & requirements

  • You know PHP and are familiar with OOP. You'll need these skills to code to the interfaces that we will provide for interacting with our system.
  • You have probably used Guzzle in the past, and if you haven't, then a quick read of the documentation interests you. Some of the work that you'll be doing will involve APIs, and where those APIs do not have SDKs, you'll use Guzzle - or something like it.
  • You have parsed complex text-based files with code in the past, and - as a result - you write defensive code to protect from data that doesn't exactly meet the spec.
  • You have 10 or more hours per week - primarily during business hours in the Eastern time zone - to dedicate to these efforts.
  • You are comfortable working closely with another developer, who will have a large say in the architecture of the code you're writing.
  • You know how to submit a pull request on GitHub - or similar - and are comfortable having your submitted code peer-reviewed.
  • You are comfortable jumping on a call with other stakeholders to talk through implementation details.

About WealthConductor LLC

WealthConductor, LLC is a newly launched firm in the financial services industry that delivers retirement income planning and tracking software to financial advisors nationwide. Our existing product IncomeConductor (IC) is a unique and highly competitive SaaS application with an established user base and aggressive growth plans.

 IC is designed to help advisors easily and intuitively design, implement and monitor income plans for their clients. Their clients include pre-retirees, retirees, and any individual or organization seeking a long-term plan for generating sustainable income from existing savings. We have been helping advisors achieve this goal for over two years now, and have been incorporating their feedback into our strategy and our tools to better serve their needs.

About WealthConductor LLC

We are a small but highly experienced team that has focused on providing tools and services to financial advisors for use with their clients and to grow their business. We collectively have decades of experience with retirement income distribution strategies and implementation.

Benefits

Equity participation, options pool
Partial remote work schedule
Work/Life balance

items.title: Fullstack Application Developers Interested in Sports at VNN Inc (Grand Rapids, MI) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Education, E-Sports, Publishing
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

VNN is looking for experienced Fullstack/PHP Application developers with an interest in sports. People who  can make insightful, rapid, every-day decisions needed in a startup environment.

VNN enables athletic departments to leverage social technologies to promote their sports teams, in doing so crafting a unique and memorable experience for athletes. This person will be comfortable joining a small team leading that charge, based on a keen understanding of VNN’s business goals and strategy.

We favor people who have a passion for sports, and can bring that background and insight into their daily development decisions. We need those who thrive on the pace of a start-up and embrace the many different roles they will have to play. Yet you will still be able to adapt processes and maintain strong design principles, making the trade-offs needed to meet timely delivery schedules.

While you’ll be responsible to work with a small team to ensure the successful execution of our technology strategy, you shouldn’t view yourself as a simple “developer”. Your success will also result from cultivating an ongoing relationship with operations, sales, marketing, technology partners, and advertisers leveraging those unique insights to craft user experience. Being able to work independently and in collaborative phases is a must.

Skills & Requirements

The ideal candidate will be able to meet the requires defined here: What is a Full Stack Developer?

Plus:

  • Be within 4 hours driving distance of Grand Rapids MI
  • 4+ years experience in PHP/MySQL, as well as experience with different programming languages/paradigms
  • A passion for building software to solve complex problems
  • Ability to change directions and priorities often and quickly
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills needed for the success of a remote group that leverages Slack and Hangouts
  • Interested in Sports or related activities

About VNN Inc

VNN Inc is a rapidly growing, highly progressive company that is reshaping high school sports media from the ground up.  Regardless of the role, the VNN team embraces the power of storytelling, and works to bring clarity, beauty and fun to technology that enables fans to share the stories of high school athletes.  We are a company of 20 passionate makers and hustlers, who believe in the disruptive impact the right team and technology can have on an industry.  Our work begins with a deep understanding of the parents, athletes, coaches and administrators that make up high school sports, and ends with simple fun products that impact real people across the country. 

Working with our tight-knit team, you won’t have to worry about big company bureaucracy or not having an impact, the code you work on will be used by thousands on a daily basis.

Benefits

Free Snacks
Great working environment
Get Paid What you Deserve
Health Care
Flexible Remote Team

items.title: Senior Full-Stack PHP Developer at Telesero () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: CRM, Enterprise Software, Telecommunications
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Description

As a PHP Developer you will have a range of projects with a focus on Database applications and development architecture.

Responsibilities

  • Designing, developing, debugging, implementing and supporting applications and services.
  • Modify existing software to: correct errors, allow it to function in new operating environment, or improve performance.
  • Design, develop and test end-to-end web, desktop and system applications using several different technologies.
  • Adhering to and recommending improvements to project coding standards.
  • Be responsible for maintaining, expanding and scaling systems.
  • Stay up to date on emerging technologies/industry trends.
  • Debug issues and find fixes in a timely manner.
  • Be able to consistently deliver on-time and at the highest quality.
  • Be mostly available in EST time zone.

Required Skills

  • Minimum 5 years of related programming, testing and system architecture experience.
  • Strong PHP5 and PHP7 coding skills.
  • Solid OOP & design patterns background.
  • Knowing Symfony is considered as an asset.
  • Experience on DBMS (Mysql/MariaDB)
  • Experience on ORM
  • Experience with APIs, Caching Solutions and 3rd Party Integrations.
  • Experience with Git.
  • Experience with client-side scripting in JavaScript and/or jQuery and comfortable working knowledge of HTML and CSS.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to learn and adapt quickly to various new technologies.

Additional Skills

  • Fluent oral and written communication skills (English is a must)
  • Strong time management while working remotely.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to self-manage.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

**Notes on Salary**
We understand that salaries range based on Geographic location mostly, experience and other factors. We are open to paying a fair salary to all employees. 

About Telesero

Telesero is a Customer Interaction Management Software company focused on Communication and Automation. Telesero is Enterprise-Level software for Small, Medium and Large businesses. Mainly focused on Customer Interaction and Communication. Telesero provides omni-channel communication tools for customers to communicate with potential, and existing customers. Automation and Workforce management tools are also a heavy focus of Telesero. Bringing automation, and eliminating human error through the use of software.

Benefits

Longterm Growth Potential
Experienced Team
Longterm Business Strategy

items.title: codelathe: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer

Posted Dec 6

codelathe
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://www.getfilecloud.com/jobs/

About CodeLathe

At CodeLathe, we are building the world’s most powerful unified file services platform that organizes enterprise data, enhances collaboration and productivity while providing ironclad data protection. Our product FileCloud is quickly becoming the standard in Enterprise File Services space and it is widely used by Global 2000, Fortune 500 and world leading organizations in city, state and federal governments. We are based out of Austin, Texas, USA and looking for talented people anywhere in the globe. 

Our Vision

Organize enterprise information and make it universally accessible!

Top Ten Reasons to Join Us

  1. Work with a world class engineering team that is out to change the world
  2. Fast growing company with lots of growth opportunities
  3. Strong engineering and product focused culture
  4. 100% Remote Job – Work comfortably from your home office and avoid the commute
  5. Unique, customer driven software development process
  6. Work on the most challenging technical problems – File Systems, Search, AI, Distributed Systems.
  7. Work on widely used cutting edge tech stack
  8. Gender diversity – Men (60%), Women (40%)
  9. Part of a huge 10+ Billion $ and growing market space
  10. Competitive compensation based on experience and location

Responsibilities

  • Create elegant, efficient and maintainable software to support and extend our current software products
  • Solve complex architectural challenges when implementing new features
  • Integrate with databases, file systems, cloud services when delivering solutions
  • Troubleshoot and fix reported customer issues, delivering software patches as needed

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or in related discipline with 4 or more years of professional software engineering experience, at least 3 years experience in web app development
  • Strong knowledge of web technologies including HTTP protocol, XML, REST is required
  • Strong knowledge of Object Oriented programming, design patterns etc is required
  • Strong knowledge of client server architecture is required
  • 4+ years in PHP development is required
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 is required
  • Familiarity with SQL/NoSQL databases like MongoDB and their declarative query languages is a plus
  • Self starter, highly motivated and works with little or no supervision
  • Passionate in software development, takes ownership and pride in their job


Location: Remote.  Compensation is based on experience and location. 

Apply for this position

Send a resume to jobs@codelathe.com. Please refer Job ID: FSE4 as a subject line.

items.title: X-Team: WordPress/PHP Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

We are a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. Learn more about how we can help you learn and grow at https://x-team.com/unleash/

 

About You:

The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.

 

Most important:

- Professional experience with PHP 5, MySQL and WordPress

- MVC frameworks like Laravel or Symfony

- HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery

- Ability to build and consume RESTful web services.

- Competent with revision control systems (Git)

- Code optimization and performance improvements

- Knowledge common Design Patterns (SOLID).

- Passionate about writing beautiful and clean code

 

Nice to have:

- Experience with working remotely

- Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

 

Personal:

- Independent, self-motivated

- Fluent in English, written and spoken

- Proven track record of always learning and growing.

- Proactive attitude

- Possess a spirit of generosity

 

Perks:

- Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.

- Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.

- Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.

- Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to join engaging engineering roundtable discussions, AMAs, gaming clubs, LAN parties, charitable fundraisers, fitness programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.

- We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. (http://x-team.com/unleash)

 

FAQ:

Who is X-Team meant for?

- Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

 

What are you hiring for right now?

- We are hiring for PHP developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We're also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

 

Will I get a job immediately after applying?

- If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

 

What kind of opportunities do you provide?

- We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

 

Job Perks: Visit http://x-team.com/join to learn more.

Apply:

items.title: Veteran WordPress Developer @ Artbees
items.content:
Veteran WordPress Developer @ Artbees

2017-12-04 15:04

Description

Artbees is looking for a full-time Veteran WordPress Developer. We are specialized in building WordPress themes and plugins, so a strong familiarity and interest in WordPress and its platform is a must. Your major responsibility as a Full Stack Developer will be to extend the capabilities of WordPress by building tools and modules that will make website building a fun and interactive experience.If you’re passionate about WordPress, write clean, well-documented code and are interested in tackling a series of new, exciting projects, we want to talk to you.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 years experience coding skills with WordPress
  • Professional level backend and frontend coding skills
  • Hands on custom WordPress development at scale
  • An excellent Knowledge of PHP
  • Deep understanding of WordPress architecture, developing custom themes, custom content types and creating custom plugins
  • Fluid knowledge of JavaScript (we do not mean jQuery, you must write great Vanilla JS)
  • Ability to work with Git
  • Ability to work with CI tools is a bonus
  • Experience creating, building and working with APIs
  • Knowledge in WordPress security and optimization
  • Familiar with Agile and Scrum workflows
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills in English
  • Have had a team work experience (with developers and QA team)

Responsibilities

items.title: WordPress Developer
items.content:
The VIP team is a diverse, hard working and kind group of people from a wide variety of backgrounds who bring excellence in software engineering, communication and problem-solving skills to help our clients and partners do amazing things with WordPress. Our company is completely distributed, so we work from anywhere we can find a good broadband connection.

As some of the biggest brands on the web, our clients are often pushing the limits of WordPress. The VIP team works to help our clients get the most out of WordPress, doing everything from providing guidance, to reviewing their code to ensure security and performance, to developing new tools to help improve our platform.

VIP Developers work in three squads, each with different day-to-day responsibilities. Developers have the flexibility to move between squads or stay on one squad.

Launch Squad:

  • Work closely with a client to advise them on the best way to structure their theme or plugins
  • Review code and provide feedback and guidance to client developers
  • Help guide clients through the launch of their sites
  • Assist with content migration
  • Think proactively for clients as they head into launch

Enterprise Squad:

  • Guide large organizations with architectural decisions, including the ongoing development of new features and functionality
  • Understand the organization’s needs at a deep level, and be able to recommend best practices and workflows as well as tools and plugins
  • Review client themes, plugins, and technical integrations
  • Debug complex problems and anticipate potential future needs and challenges

Developer Squad:

  • Debug complex problems encountered by clients
  • Build tools to help the support team be more efficient
  • Work on plugins for clients and the community
  • Do performance audits of sites
  • Add or debug platform level issues impacting all clients
  • Fix security issues impacting the platform or popular plugins
  • Help with occasional day to day code review

You’ll have the ability to set your own schedule outside of a required 4 to 8 hours a week of “on call” time for urgents and code deployments. This will typically fall during your morning or afternoon, although some weekend work is possible.

We’re looking for developers who have:

  • Minimum 2 years of WordPress specific experience – experience with performance and security a bonus
  • Strong debugging skills
  • A desire to learn and grow
  • Great communication skills

Want to learn more about who you’ll be working with? Check out: vip.wordpress.com/jobs/

A great way to know if you have the development skills required for the position is to review the Intentionally Vulnerable Plugin and see if you can find the vulnerabilities. Bonus points for catching the VIP specific feedback that you can find here: https://vip.wordpress.com/documentation/code-review-what-we-look-for/

items.title: Senior Full Stack PHP Developer
items.content:
Job Description


As a PHP Developer you will have a range of projects with a focus on Database applications and development architecture.


Responsibilities



  • Designing, developing, debugging, implementing and supporting applications and services.

  • Modify existing software to: correct errors, allow it to function in new operating environment, or improve performance.

  • Design, develop and test end-to-end web, desktop and system applications using several different technologies.

  • Adhering to and recommending improvements to project coding standards.

  • Be responsible for maintaining, expanding and scaling systems.

  • Stay up to date on emerging technologies/industry trends.

  • Debug issues and find fixes in a timely manner.

  • Be able to consistently deliver on-time and at the highest quality.

  • Be mostly available in EST time zone.


Required Skills



  • Minimum 5 years of related programming, testing and system architecture experience.

  • Strong PHP5 and PHP7 coding skills.

  • Solid OOP & design patterns background.

  • Knowing Symfony is considered as an asset.

  • Experience on DBMS (Mysql/MariaDB)

  • Experience on ORM

  • Experience with APIs, Caching Solutions and 3rd Party Integrations.

  • Experience with Git.

  • Experience with client-side scripting in JavaScript and/or jQuery and comfortable working knowledge of HTML and CSS.

  • Excellent communication skills.

  • Ability to learn and adapt quickly to various new technologies.


Additional Skills



  • Fluent oral and written communication skills (English is a must)

  • Strong time management while working remotely.

  • Strong work ethic and ability to self-manage.

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.


**Notes on Salary**
We understand that salaries range based on Geographic location mostly, experience and other factors. We are open to paying a fair salary to all employees.

items.title: Lead Developer for Language-Learning Startup
items.content:
Langu is a fast-growing UK-based language-learning startup that has achieved significant traction and is looking for a new full-stack developer to continue development and help us push into new directions. This is an exciting opportunity take the tech reigns of an established startup with tons of room to grow.

The successful candidate will need to work with the existing stack, although we are flexible about what kinds of technologies you choose to develop further features with. The core of the platform is PHP, though you may not need to be a full-on PHP developer.

Must have:
* PHP 5/7 (modern MVC frameworks, preferably Symfony 2.x/3.x)
* Javascript (jQuery)
* Linux administration (preferably Ubuntu)
* Experience working across full software-development lifecycle
* MySQL
* A keen eye for UX/UI

Desirable:
* Javascript (modern front-end framework)
* Experience working with 3rd party APIs
* Ansible, Docker, Redis
* Another modern object-oriented programming language (Java, C#, Python)

We’re looking for someone with a passion for building technologies that connect people, building tools that bring down barriers to language learning.

At the core of your initial responsibilities will be to redevelop our v1 virtual classroom, currently powered by WebRTC (via Tokbox) and Google Realtime API, to include lots more real-time interactive tools and possibly to develop white-label platforms for, among other uses, sports applications. Realtime API will soon be deprecated and needs to be redeveloped using some combination of WebRTC, HTML5 or websockets. This is a big endeavour that will suit someone looking for a major portfolio project.

We are 100% open to remote working arrangements. We’d love to see you in person whenever possible, but we don’t believe in the necessity of a permanent office.

We will consider candidates with a variety of backgrounds, from students/recent grads to seasoned veterans. We place high value in passion, vision and communication skills. And we would ideally begin working with you on a part-time basis and can offer £20-35k pa depending on experience.

We offer:

* The opportunity for a pivotal role at an established early-stage startup, helping lead a revolution in how languages are learned.
* Ability to work from home, with flexibility on your working hours.
* Autonomy in a collaborative and supportive environment.
* The chance to develop exciting and significant projects you can call your own.
* Access to an extensive mentoring network and startup community through our accelerator, Ignite.

A bit about Langu:

* We launched an MVP in late 2016, rebuilt/re-launched the platform in February 2017, taken on 3 small rounds of investment, and are currently part of the Ignite Accelerator in the UK.
* Our platform connects professional language teachers with language students for live online lessons in our own virtual classroom.
* We have achieved significant monthly growth on minimal marketing spend and are looking to reach the next level of scale.
* We’re currently a team of 4, and surrounded by a broad network of committed advisors and investors.

To apply, please send us your CV and include a few words about your interest in the role as well as any links that will help us get to know you and your work better (websites worked on, Github, Twitter, LinkedIn etc).

(Strictly no agencies, please.)

items.title: Front-end Developer & Designer @ Institute for Nonprofit News
items.content:
Front-end Developer & Designer @ Institute for Nonprofit News

2017-11-23 20:54

Description

The Institute for Nonprofit News (INN), a network of 130+ nonprofit news organizations, has an immediate opening for a full-time designer-developer with INN Labs, our product and technology team. We focus on solving problems that we are uniquely suited to tackle at a network level, such as:

  • Building open-source publishing tools to support newsrooms’ editorial and business goals
  • Providing custom web development, training, and resources to consulting clients
  • Supporting 40+ member websites using Largo, an open source WordPress platform/framework that we design, build and maintain

Our work is divided between our own projects advancing the sector as a whole and one-on-one consulting and support for members and clients.

We value diversity, work in the open, have a lot of fun, and try to do everything we can to give back to the journalism-tech community. (Read more about our team values here.)

You can find even more about us on our team blog and check out our projects on GitHub.

The ideal candidate for this position is passionate about design and looking to put their skills to use tackling problems facing nonprofit news organizations.

You’ll be joining an accomplished team and have the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects while continuing to learn and develop new skills. As the team’s go-to design and front-end expert, you will be responsible for:

  • Creating style tiles, user flows, and wireframes and/or mockups for client projects
  • Technically implementing your designs following best practices for HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (often jQuery)
  • Making strategic design decisions related to branding, new functionality and features for INN Labs products (like these)

We are flexible on exactly how this role will will fit in with the rest of the team, but here are some desired skills and attributes for the position (we understand you might not meet all of these but if this roughly sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you):

  • Previous professional experience in editorial design and technology
  • Expert knowledge of front-end web design and development (particularly HTML, CSS, and JavaScript)
  • Strong design sense and a focus on user-experience
  • Experience with rapid prototyping and an understanding of the right level of fidelity needed to clearly communicate your ideas
  • Experience working with WordPress and theming
  • Experience using git/GitHub
  • Commitment to openness and sharing/writing/talking about your work
  • Curiosity and the willingness to learn, adapt and teach

Nice to have:

  • Experience with one or more server-side programming languages (we use PHP and Python)
  • Experience working with data visualization and mapping tools
  • Photo, video, illustration or other related visual/graphic design skills
  • Experience working in an agency setting

This is a full-time position with benefits. Our compensation package is competitive and commensurate with experience. We are also committed to giving our employees the tools they need to do their job and supporting their professional growth so you’ll receive an allowance for hardware, software, travel to conferences, etc.

We are a distributed team and this is a remote position. Previous experience working remotely would be helpful but we’ll do whatever we can to help and support your transition if this is your first remote job.

INN is an equal-opportunity employer, and we are committed to creating a workplace where diversity is valued. People of color, women, and members of other under-represented groups in journalism, media, and technology are strongly encouraged to apply. In addition to federal law requirements, INN complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

The application deadline is Monday, Dec. 4, 2017.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Lead Full-Stack Developer - PHP & Laravel
items.content:
About Carhopper

Carhopper is a company of tech enthusiasts and car zealots. Through our combined passions, we have created the premier, online, luxury car rental platform in the world.

We operate in eight locations across four states in the United States and are quickly expanding to new markets. Our users use our self-service website and mobile apps to easily rent luxury cars -- anything from a Mustang to Ferrari to a Lamborghini. 

Our team is 100% remote and our headquarters are in Miami.

Our Stack

Laravel, PHP, MySQL, SASS, Gulp, Redis, jQuery, Android + iOS apps (non-native, web)

About the Role

As Lead Developer at Carhopper, you will provide technical leadership, make good architectural decision, write code, and help grow the engineering team. You will be working directly with the CEO to help build the premiere online destination for luxury car bookings.

On the technical side, you will write full-stack code -- Laravel (PHP) on the backend and JS on the frontend. You will write new features for web and mobile as well as build API integrations between Carhopper and various other services. As we encounter new opportunities, you will be responsible for scoping and planning the software build-out so that we can continue to deliver great experiences.

To apply: Apply here:https://carhopperinc.recruitee.com/o/lead-fullstack-developer-php-laravel/c/newApplications coming in anywhere else (email, anywhere else) will not be read.

items.title: PHP Senior Back End Developer (100% Remote Work) at Time Doctor () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer

Job description

This is a 100% remote position. We prefer to hire people from Europe and Asia because of team collaboration, all of our current dev team is in Asia or Europe and so it is unlikely (although not impossible) that we will hire in north or south america.

 You will be working from home with mostly flexible hours although you will need to attend the team meeting which is at approximately 8:30am GMT and to work for 3 hours after this time for team collaboration (This is 3:30am to 6:30am New York time, so you can see that’s the reason we are not likely to hire in north, central or south america).

WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

You will be working in a team of around 10 other developers. You primary areas of work will be:

  1. Building and maintaining external integrations with partners through different communication protocols - REST / SOAP etc …
  2. Integrations with Zapier
  3. Working on queue management back-end solutions helping these integrations to operate properly
  4. Working on developing back-end modules / services part of the whole product infrastructure
  5. Working with databases with millions of records and hundreds of thousands of requests per day.
  6. You are going to get involved into continuous integration processes, different branching models for version control and strict coding standards.
  7. Work on highly scalable cloud infrastructure including multiple instances connected by load balancers for traffic distribution

TO BE A BEST FIT FOR THIS JOB YOU NEED TO:

  • be an expert in PHP at least 5+ years. Expert means that you have solid experience in building web based applications with high level of abstraction
  • be an expert in External API Integrations and have a quick understanding how an integration can be done - REST / SOAP
  • have a good experience in MVC frameworks
  • have a good experience with Symfony Framework
  • have a good experience of building DDD oriented architecture
  • have a solid experience in code optimization and performance improvements
  • know how the core of MySQL is working, make decisions about the storage engines, database structure and scalability of the database
  • know how to optimize database performance
  • be able to solve complex bugs often quite quickly
  • always document your code on a good level
  • have a basic understanding of any Javascript Framework but preferably React
  • have a good understanding and experience with MongoDB or other no SQL databases
  • know what is continous integration and how it works

Experience or knowledge how Amazon services like EC2, RDS, CloudFront work is a plus

To apply for this job, you MUST apply in this link https://timedoctor.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0fpji and  make sure you answer the questions and attach your UPDATED resume.


NOTE: ONLY those who apply in the application link and email the requirements will be accepted.

About Time Doctor

Time Doctor is a time tracking and productivity tool. Our software can be used by an individual or a team to track time for tasks and monitor computer activity, such as taking screenshots while you’re working, monitor keyboard and mouse activity and track web app and website usage.

We have a team of over 65 people working 100% remotely in 8 different countries.  More about us here: https://www.timedoctor.com/about-us.html

items.title: PHP Entwickler (m/w) to break limits in WordPress! Liebe Herausforderungen! at Inpsyde GmbH () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Web Design, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Du bist erfahrene/r oder talentierter Webentwickler/in auf den man sich verlassen kann, kennst dich mit objekt-orientierter PHP-Programmierung aus und möchtest zusammen mit anderen Top WordPress Entwicklern anspruchsvolle WordPress-Projekte mit höchster Code-Qualität im B2B-Bereich umsetzen?

Dann kannst du dir sicherlich vorstellen unter anderem an folgenden spannenden Projekten zu arbeiten:

  • In einem mehrsprachigen WooCommerce-Shop mit Anbindung an externe Dienste wie zum Beispiel SAP Business One
  • Weiterentwicklung und Support bekannter freier Plugins (z.B. BackWPup oder MultilingualPress)
  • Gestalten/Entwickeln maßgeschneiderter hoch performanter und sicherer Plugins, Schnittstellen und Themes für unsere Kunden, Dienstleister und die Community

Dich erwartet:

  • arbeiten im Homeoffice (wir sind 100% Remote)
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • sehr erfahrene WordPress Experten und Top SE User als Kollegen
  • als WordPress VIP Partner, direkter Draht zu WooCommerce und WP Core Entwickler
  • ganz nah am Puls der neuesten WordPress-Entwicklung und Technologien
  • spannende und außergewöhnliche Projekte
  • kleines Team in einem agilen Umfeld
  • wöchentlicher Wissenaustausch und Vorträge von Kollegen in einer Videokonferenz
  • tolle Kollegen, mit denen es jeden Tag Freude macht zusammenzuarbeiten
  • Besuche und Vorträge auf WordCamps und WooConf
  • flache Hierachien und kurze Entscheidungswege

Eintrittsdatum: So schnell wie möglich. Aber bei guten Entwicklern warten wir gerne.

Klingt alles interessant für dich? Dann bewerbe dich jetzt inkl. deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen, frühestmögliches Eintrittsdatum, Link zu deinem GitHub Account damit wir uns deine Code-Qualität anschauen können!

About Inpsyde GmbH

Arbeite mit unserem tollen Team von WordPress Experten und Top Usern auf WordPress Stack Exchange zusammen. Tausche dich aus, lerne von Ihnen oder lass dich gemeinsam im Team zu Höchstleistungen verleiten.

Im Gegensatz zu gewöhnlichen Arbeitgebern arbeitest du bei uns remote an immer neuen Herausforderungen in der WordPress Welt, wo du willst – in der Nähe deiner Kaffeemaschine, im Park oder an deinem Lieblingsort. Das bedeutet auch, dass du deine Arbeitszeiten flexibel einteilen kannst.

Via Slack, Hangout und Zoom kommunizierst du mit deinen Kollegen, während du unter anderem mit deiner Hardware und deinem Lieblingskaffee deine Arbeitsumgebung selbst gestaltest.

Oder treffe dich mit Kollegen auf WordCamps, Meetups oder WooConfs weltweit um sich dort auch mit anderen Entwicklern auszutauschen oder im Auftrage der Firma Vorträge zu halten.

Entwickle WordPress Plugins oder Webseiten für internationale Firmen wie Facebook, Mercedes, Parship oder WooCommerce Erweiterungen für E-Commerce Größen wie PayPal. Aber auch für Mittelstandsunternehmen, die Webseiten oder Plugins nicht von der Stange benötigen. 

Auch beteiligst du dich an der Mitarbeit an Plugins, die wir auf wordpress.org zur Verfügung stellen, wie zum Beispiel BackWPup mit über 5 Millionen Downloads und über 600.000 aktive User.

In kleinen Teams, einem Projektleiter und direktem Draht zum Chef kannst du dich und deine Ideen wertvoll einbringen.

Bewirb dich als PHP-Entwickler/in! Viele aufregende Möglichkeiten warten auf dich!

Werde Inpsyder!

Benefits

Homeoffice und flexible Arbeitszeiten - Wir Vertrauen unserem Team!
Keine langen Anfahrtszeiten! Vom Frühstückstisch in 1 Min. am Rechner!
28 Tage Urlaub
Immer in der Nähe der Familie um die man sich jederzeit kümmern kann.
Zuhause essen wo es am besten schmeckt anstatt labriges Kantinenfutter
Wir arbeiten mit Spaß! Flache Hierachien und gegenseitiger Respekt!
Nutzung der Tools deiner Wahl!
Kostenloses Spazierengehen, um den Kopf manchmal frei zu kriegen

items.title: Write quality code that scales as our new backend dev at Savvii Managed WordPress Hosting (Nijmegen, Netherlands) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer, System Administrator
Industry: Cloud Services, Network Engineering, Web Hosting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Do words like GIT, Ruby, AMQP, Docker, PHP, Composer, PHP unit and Redis make your developer heart beat faster? Do these technologies hold few secrets for you and are you capable of converting ideas into working and secure applications? If so, then we want to meet you.

We are looking for a creative developer to develop and maintain our back-end systems and web applications. In this position, you will work as part of a professional and enthusiastic team on optimising and developing our REST API, provisioning tools, client portals, ordering systems and other (web-based) applications.

Who are you?

  • Minimum higher vocational education (HBO) work and thinking level, with relevant work experience.
  • You are fluent in either PHP or Ruby and are willing to study other languages. Knowledge of Linux and WordPress is a prerequisite
  • Familiar with current (web) technologies such as Docker, Elasticsearch, Rails or AMQP. Knowledge of testing frameworks and deployment strategies.
  • A team player: Curious, enterprising and creative.

Job description

  • As a member of a team, you will work on automation, features and maintenance for a hosting platform with which we serve thousands of clients
  • You will work using Scrum tools to improve our platform in an agile manner
  • You believe in as much automation of processes as possible to ensure the highest possible level of uniformity and quality across the entire hosting platform
  • You can serve as a technical consultant for both internal departments and clients

You and Savvii

Starting on your first day at the company, you will be an essential part of a professional team. Your future? You will shape your own future by continuously developing yourself and by proactively seizing opportunities. We believe that your added value is greatest if you enjoy your work. We consider personal development, responsibility and substantial challenges to be essential to ensure the enjoyment of the work. Because we give you the space to utilize your talents to their full extent and through the sparring opportunities with skilled colleagues, you will continually work on your own development.

What makes it attractive for you to work for us?

  • Competitive salary that grows in tandem with your ambition
  • Informal work environment in a modern building equipped with lounge and roof terrace or a remote position
  • New Macbook Pro or Dell XPS laptop to enable you to work smoothly
  • Challenging work with your own responsibilities and growth potential
  • Training opportunities
  • Time to visit conferences
  • Time to contribute to Open Source
  • Time to experiment with new web technologies, such as in the form of hackathons
  • 100% travel allowance when travelling by public transport
  • Supplemental: chair massage by a real professional, company fitness programme, free fruit and media library

About Savvii Managed WordPress Hosting

About your team

Our dev team consists of 4 developers based in Nijmegen. We are also open to remote colleagues. Will you be the first of many new colleagues?

We believe in trying lots of new things, but in a way that is stable and scales across thousands of sites and servers. Things like TDD, (internal) penetration tests, code reviews and CI are our way of guaranteeing code quality.

There is room to contribute to Open Source projects, visit conferences and enhance your public speaking skills.

We are working with SCRUM, the team has either control about scope or planning.

What unites us is a love of games, tinkering with computers and electronics and throwing the occasional LAN or VR party at the office.

About Savvii

Savvii is the Managed WordPress host in Europe. Only hosting, only WordPress. Full stop.

This focus enables us to offer our clients the best hosting. We innovate continuously in the area of speed, scalability, security and convenience.

Our company is made up of young people with a passion for technology, gadgets and the latest developments on the Internet. As an organisation, we place a high value on commitment and we ensure that you can demonstrate an entrepreneurial character. At our company, you are allowed to make mistakes. We are open about that: internally and towards our clients. We also believe in sharing: for example, we organise the WordPress meet-up Nijmegen, sponsor and organise WordCamps and we also speak at WordCamps and other conferences.

Are you the candidate that we’re looking for? If so, don’t wait any longer and apply. A Certificate of Good Behaviour [Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag] will also be required as part of the application procedure.

For more information, please contact Lisa Nellestijn, our HR advisor, at +31(0)24-3605040. Of course, you can always stop by for a cup of coffee or tea to get an impression of the pleasant working atmosphere.

Benefits

Chair Massage
Free fruit
Remote working
MacBook Pro's
Contribution to your sports and excercise costs
Attending conferences
Contributing to Open Source initiatives

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
The Company

We're a growth-stage company building a low-code business platform in the cloud.Our recently expanded management team has a track record of success with startups.Development staff work remotely. The company is headquartered near Philly.We enjoy competitive salaries, health benefits, stock options, product ownership, unlimited PTO, and more.

The Stack

Zengine's backend is a REST API, built on a LAMP stack using CakePHP.
Its frontend is a single page app, built using AngularJS.
Its "serverless" plugin architecture is powered by Node.js and AWS Lambda.
The whole stack is Docker native, and continuously delivered to AWS.

You

If you're comfortable in a fast-paced environment, value team collaboration, pride yourself on attention to detail, and are hungry to continually learn, then we want to hear from you.

  • Adherence to coding standards
  • A methodical approach to testing code
  • Knowing when, why & how to refactor
  • Familiarity with application security best practices (esp. OWASP)
  • Understanding of query & request optimization techniques (including experience with complex MySQL operations and distributed caching)
  • Proficiency with common DevOps tooling (containerization, VMs, various AWS services, Logstash + Kibana, etc)

items.title: Sr Software Engineer to Build Event Platform
items.content:
WHAT WE DO
Events are where we go to be inspired by those who've followed their dreams, learn from the people who want us to succeed, build life-long friendships and discover new opportunities.

Our goal is to help organizers succeed in building more of these unforgettable events. Thousands of events depend on Sched, like tech conferences, comic conventions, music festivals, yoga festivals, professional development days and even furry conventions. Seriously, there is an event for everything.

You'll be building something that makes a real difference to our customers. Here's actual feedback about what you'll be building:

  • I wonder what the world did before Sched...
  • Sched completely revolutionized our convention.
  • Sched is pretty fuckin' awesome.
  • Using Sched is something I actively LOOK FORWARD TO whenever we're getting ready to put on another event.

YOU ARE
  • Driven to work on something that has thousands of passionate customers — and make it even better.
  • Excited to take a critical role in building out better processes for getting things done at Sched.
  • Outstanding with communication skills and the ability to keep your team in the loop.
  • Self-motivated to take on responsibilities and meet deadlines.
  • Ready to work with a small team that has your back and will support your growth.

YOUR EXPERIENCE
  • 5+ years experience building or scaling a SaaS platform.
  • Experience leading or taking initiative in a team environment to spec and ship time-sensitive solutions.
  • Highly experienced with PHP, MySQL, HTML, JS.
  • Super comfortable working within a legacy codebase and making improvements along the way.
  • Amazing ability to solve problems independently and communicate challenges with your team.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Develop and ship improvements and new features to help event organizers run better events. Working together as a small team means you'll get to wear many different hats and have a substantial impact on our product and company success.

LOCATION
As part of Sched's remote-only team, you can work from anywhere in the world. Some of our team use the flexibility to work from home. Some of our team use it to travel. It's up to you. Our founder has lived in Airbnbs for the past 5 years.

We get together throughout the year in incredible places like Bali, Tokyo, Berlin and Mykonos, all covered by Sched. Part work, part vacation, we call them #schedcations. Want to join us?

PAY & BENEFITS
Salary is dependent on experience. Generous benefits include paying you to take vacation, conferences stipends, equipment when needed and flexible hours.

To apply: Email jobs@sched.com with the subject line 'I want to join Sched' and tell us:A bit about you & why you're a great fit for our team.A recent team accomplishment that you are proud of and why.Links to Github or social media or a personal site that helps us get to know you.Ask us one question about Sched.

items.title: Lead Wordpress Engineer at Mediavine (Saint Paul, MN) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Advertising, Advertising Technology, Publishing
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Mediavine, a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 1,900 websites in the food, lifestyle, and entertainment space, is searching for a Lead Wordpress Engineer to assist in building solutions for our publishers and work with our engineering team to launch new products. We are looking for a mid-to-senior level developer to lead our Wordpress team in building plugins, themes, and integrations with our backend.

We are looking for someone with great organizational skills, as well as someone who cares deeply about the quality of the product they are building. We're a primarily remote team, so experience with leading a remote team is greatly desired.

As an engineer at Mediavine you can expect to:

  • Conceptualize and create new wordpress plugins
  • Work with design team to optimize user experience
  • Develop ways to automate and optimize development
  • Manage plugin rollouts to our publishers
  • Ensure all plugins have met QA requirements

REQUIREMENTS

Must haves

  • 2-4 years professional experience
  • Contributes to/Owner of at least one published plugin with 100+ active installs
  • Experience working with Subversion and/or Git
  • Experience working with Javascript frameworks
  • Continuous drive to learn
  • Project lead experience
  • Deep familiarity with Wordpress core
  • 2+ Years in customer facing role (customer service, support, etc)
  • Experience with TDD, including wordpress testing frameworks
  • Located within the United States

Bonus points for

  • Experience/Comfort working with Agile Frameworks like SCRUM
  • Eye for Design
  • Experience developing new frameworks
  • Located within the Twin Cities Metro area

About Mediavine

Mediavine has been an internet publisher since 2004. We own and operate The Hollywood Gossip, TV Fanatic, Movie Fanatic and Food Fanatic.

In 2013, when Food Fanatic was launched and our relationship with bloggers began, we learned we weren’t alone in our frustrations with the way most ad networks are run. Since then we've teamed up with over 2000 different publishers to create frustration free advertising experiences running high quality, non intrusive and relevant advertisements.

Benefits

Travel
Flexible Hours
Work Remote
Comprehensive Benefits
Work with emerging Tech
401k

items.title: PHP Back-end Developer - Integrations Specialist - 100% Remote at Time Doctor () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer

Job description

This is a 100% remote position. We prefer to hire people from Europe and Asia because of team collaboration, all of our current dev team is in Asia or Europe and so it is unlikely (although not impossible) that we will hire in north or south america.

You will be working from home with mostly flexible hours although you will need to attend the team meeting which is at approximately 8:30am GMT and to work for 3 hours after this time for team collaboration (This is 3:30am to 6:30am New York time, so you can see that’s the reason we are not likely to hire in north, central or south america).

WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

You will be working in a team of around 10 other developers. You primary areas of work will be:

  1. Building and maintaining external integrations with partners through different communication protocols - REST / SOAP etc …
  2. Integrations with Zapier
  3. Working on queue management back-end solutions helping these integrations to operate properly
  4. Working on developing back-end modules / services part of the whole product infrastructure
  5. Working with databases with millions of records and hundreds of thousands of requests per day.
  6. You are going to get involved into continuous integration processes, different branching models for version control and strict coding standards.
  7. Work on highly scalable cloud infrastructure including multiple instances connected by load balancers for traffic distribution

TO BE A BEST FIT FOR THIS JOB YOU NEED TO:

  • be an expert in PHP at least 5+ years. Expert means that you have solid experience in building web based applications with high level of abstraction
  • be an expert in External API Integrations and have a quick understanding how an integration can be done - REST / SOAP
  • have a good experience in MVC frameworks
  • have a good experience with Symfony Framework
  • have a good experience of building DDD oriented architecture
  • have a solid experience in code optimization and performance improvements
  • know how the core of MySQL is working, make decisions about the storage engines, database structure and scalability of the database
  • know how to optimize database performance
  • be able to solve complex bugs often quite quickly
  • always document your code on a good level
  • have a basic understanding of any Javascript Framework but preferably React
  • have a good understanding and experience with MongoDB or other noSQL databases
  • know what is continous integration and how it works

Experience or knowledge how Amazon services like EC2, RDS, CloudFront work is a plus.

To apply for this job, you MUST answer the two questions below and email your answers to: timedoctor-tmdc0464@applications.recruiterbox.com. Make sure you also attached your UPDATED resume.
NOTE: ONLY those with answers to the two questions and resume will be accepted.

These are the questions to answer to qualify for this job:

Q1) What is persistent cookie?

a) Cookie which is stored in a cookie file permanently on the browser
b) Cookie which is stored in a cookie file permanently on the file server
c) Cookie which is more secured than a regular cookie

Q2) Can you extend Final Defined class?
a) Yes, only once
b) Yes, multiple times
c) No

About Time Doctor

Time Doctor is a time tracking and productivity tool. Our software can be used by an individual or a team to track time for tasks and monitor computer activity, such as taking screenshots while you’re working, monitor keyboard and mouse activity and track web app and website usage.

We have a team of over 65 people working 100% remotely in 8 different countries.  More about us here: https://www.timedoctor.com/about-us.html

https://www.linkedin.com/company/time-doctor

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Mobile Development, Wearable Electronics, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

This position is for US residents only.

Accella is looking for a developer with experience building websites and modules in Drupal. The candidate will need to show an expertise in Drupal development that goes deeper than basic theming and should have experience building custom modules and integrating with third party applications and services.

In addition to Drupal experience, we are looking for a candidate with a mixed skillset, including experience developing native or Xamarin based mobile applications and/or experience with .NET or Ruby development. While the position will be Drupal focused, it is likely the candidate will be asked to work on projects ranging from web to mobile, so we are looking for a more well-rounded individual in terms of a technology background.

We will heavily weigh the applicants problem solving skills. Must be highly motivated and a serious self starter.

Must have the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical resources. We are looking for someone that enjoys being part of a team and will offer feedback and ideas in order to design and develop the most solid and extensible products for our clients.

We want a leader, an ideas person, and someone that is eager to work on multiple challenging projects, sometimes simultaneously.

What we expect in a candidate: 

- BS in Computer Science, BS in closely related discipline or equivalent industry experience

- Candidate must be located within the US, but can be located anywhere around the country

- 3 years experience with Drupal development

- At least 5 years experience with software development

- 1 year experience with mobile development and at least 1 app in the app store

- Effective communication skills (written and oral)

- Problem-solving and creative mindset

- Experience thriving in a high-performance, results-oriented organization

- Experience and proficiency in interacting with external clients

- Experience with Ruby on Rails a plus

About Accella

What we offer you:

- Unlimited opportunity for growth
- Competitive salary
- Health Insurance
- Full Time Telecommute (though occasional client meetings may be required)

Accella is a web, mobile, and desktop software development company with headquarters located in Severna Park, MD that was recently nominated as one of the best places to work in Baltimore. With a wide array of clients across multiple industries, our development opportunities are vast and always interesting.

Health Insurance
Paid Time Off

items.title: Data Engineer at Formstack (Indianapolis, IN) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, SaaS, Web Technology
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, is looking for a Data Engineer to add to its already awesome Dev team.

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform.

What You Will Do:

This position will focus on creating, maintaining and optimizing the way we store data. You will work with and create APIs to digest data and store within a data warehouse. You will understand how multiple data points work together and how they should be stored. You will evaluate and create services to make reporting of data easy for your co-workers. We are a data driven company and you will own all the data points the company uses to make decisions. Needless to say, you like a challenge, complex problems and responsibility.

Who You Are:

You are a problem solver and are motivated to learn. You are a great communicator, collaborative, detail oriented and can see a project through from start to finish. You are able to make decisions on your own but know when to ask for help. You understand it takes a team to build something powerful and don't mind constructive feedback. You are familiar with big data storage and understand there are more ways to store things than just MySQL. You have experience in large scale data store projects and architecture and can bring some wisdom from previous projects.

Requirements

  • PHP with Unit Testing (PHPUnit)
  • Deep knowledge of SQL (MySQL and noSQL)
  • Git
  • Solid experience in at least one of the following
    • building micro services
    • high-use APIs
  • Ability to use command line tools
  • Ability to work remote and with remote team members
  • Excellent written and oral English communication skills
  • The ability to work independently but also work well within a team environment.
  • The ability to travel (<10%) for team meetups, conferences, etc.

Extra Credit Qualifications

  • Experience with AWS or comparable cloud-computing platform
  • Experience building large-scale high-performance systems
  • RJ Metrics or a similar service
  • Salesforce
  • Jupyter Notebooks experience
  • Data warehouse implementation experience

What Formstack Offers:

  • Remote environment
  • 100% Covered Medical, Dental, Vision as well as company-paid Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees
  • 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings
  • Unlimited PTO for all employees

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this Video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life.

About Formstack

Formstack is an 11 year old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a remote work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom

Benefits

The most up-to-date software
401k Safe Harbor Match
Lunch everyday paid for by Formstack (for employees in Indianapolis)
Generous PTO policy
Remote working office
All the snacks you can handle
Company-contributions to HSA
Monthly company "fun"
Yearly team-building event for the whole company
All the pings and pongs you can handle!

Job description

Lenox Park Solutions is seeking a SalesForce Software Engineer with substantial experience developing custom, institutional software. As a full-time engineer, your focus would be working closely with our Development & Marketing staff to advance the functionality and scalability of customized Lightning Orgs. Initial day-to-day will include all aspects of managing the technical requirements of this product. The ideal candidate will also grow into a more senior leadership role in managing other outsourced development projects, and will have technical expertise beyond Force.com/Apex (PHP preferred) that will inform an expanded product suite. Staff members retain the option to work remotely, as we are a goals-oriented team.

  • Professional IT/Engineering experience on SalesForce/Apex with demonstrated development and design experience, particularly experience in collaborative networks, databases, or asset management software 
  • Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written experience with technical and non-technical audiences; 
  • Ability to assess ongoing processes critically and recommend creative, thoughtful operational improvements; 
  • Bachelor’s Degree+ in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent

Preferred Skills: 

  • Experience in web development and programming in PHP; 
  • Understanding of Asset Management industry; 
  • Business-oriented, highly analytical mind with a knack for accounting for both complex business and technical considerations simultaneously

About Lenox Park Solutions LLC

Lenox Park Solutions LLC (LPS) is a FinTech firm focused on Asset Managers and Financial Institutions. Our mission is to enable the democratization of access to Institutional capital by using technology to match best-in-class Asset Allocators with the most talented Asset Managers. Our solutions will challenge entrenched traditional notions of who should be able to manage money, upending the staid model where pedigree and privilege drive capital allocation. LPS maintains offices in New York, NY and Austin, TX.

Remote Office
Experienced Investment Professionals
Austin and New York Offices
Lean, Entrepreneurial Team

items.title: Software developer C/C++ at ZF Friedrichshafen AG (Pilsen, Tschechien) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior
Industry: Automotive, Autonomous Driving, Safety Technology
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Private

Job description

WHY JOIN ZF TRW?

ZF TRW operates a global network of technical centers worldwide where we employ engineers, researchers, designers and technicians. Our global network allows us to develop active and passive automotive safety technologies, while continuously improving existing products and systems.

Employees use sophisticated testing and computer simulation equipment. We have advanced engineering and research and development programs for next-generation products in all of our segments.

ZF TRW is disciplined and innovative in our approach to research and development, employing various tools to improve efficiency and reduce cost, such as Six Sigma, "follow-the-sun" (a 24-hour a day engineering program that utilizes our global network) and other e-Engineering programs.

The safety technologies market is hot, and ZF TRW is at the forefront. Come join the global leader in automotive safety and apply today!

The Software Team is responsible for the development and release of software for a number of high profile and challenging global applications with European, North American and Chinese vehicle manufactures. A senior software engineer is required to support this development striving for customer delight with timely deliveries, novel system functions and high quality software.

  • Programming of systems of automotive components in C and C++
  • Programming of SW for testing support for those systems
  • Integration to customer products and laboratory testing
  • Problems monitoring, analysis and solving

  • Flexible working hours

  • Home office
  • Annual bonuses

  • Benefits: commuting allowances, pension/life insurance allowances
  • Lunches in our amazing canteen

items.title: Fullstack PHP Developer (Eastern Europe) (remote) at MobyMax () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software

Job description

We are looking for talented Full Stack PHP developers living in Eastern Europe who want to join our engineering team in building the future of education technology.

The position requires a developer with experience and expertise building modern web applications and mobile web apps using the latest back-end and front-end technology.  At Moby we are use a LAMP based tech stack to support over 22 million users (roughly half the schools in America use our software) giving you the opportunity to solve a variety of challenges at scale. 

The position is remote allowing you to work from the comfort of your home, and requires the ability to read, write and speak in English.  Our developers work 9am - 6pm EET.

We use Skype for most communication including voice calls so you must have conversational English skills.

Skills & Requirements:

- Work for yourself and not for an outsourcing company

- Strong knowledge of PHP (3+ years experience)

- Strong knowledge of Javascript, HTML, CSS and related tools/packages (3+ years experience)

- Strong knowledge of MySQL or Cassandra (3+ years experience)

- Knowledge of React JS

- Basic knowledge of Git, Linux and Unit Tests.

- Strong English skills (written and verbal).

Working setup:

- Work from home

- A computer that is not older than 3 years

- High speed internet

- Clear microphone / headset.

Hours:

- Willing to work 45 hours per week

- Work 9am to 6pm in the Eastern European Timezone (EET)

About MobyMax

MobyMax creates a unique, individualized education plan for each student, allowing gifted students to progress as quickly as they like while simultaneously ensuring that remedial students get the extra instruction they need.

To see what it is like for a teacher to use MobyMax in a classroom, have a look here:

http://www.vimeo.com/mobymax/mobysuccess

Benefits

Top notch pay
No commute needed
Amazing coders
See your kiddos on lunch breaks (no commute)

items.title: WordPress/PHP Developer
items.content:
WordPress/PHP Developer - Jobmote

WordPress/PHP Developer

X-Team

About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

We are a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. Learn more about how we can help you learn and grow at https://x-team.com/unleash/

 

About You:

The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.

 

Most important:

  • Professional experience with PHP 5, MySQL and WordPress

  • MVC frameworks like Laravel or Symfony

  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery

  • Ability to build and consume RESTful web services.

  • Competent with revision control systems (Git)

  • Code optimization and performance improvements

  • Knowledge common Design Patterns (SOLID).

  • Passionate about writing beautiful and clean code

 

Nice to have:

  • Experience with working remotely

  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

 

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated

  • Fluent in English, written and spoken

  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.

  • Proactive attitude

  • Possess a spirit of generosity

 

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.

  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.

  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.

  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to join engaging engineering roundtable discussions, AMAs, gaming clubs, LAN parties, charitable fundraisers, fitness programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you’re a remote developer.

  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. (http://x-team.com/unleash)

 

FAQ:

Who is X-Team meant for?

  • Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you’ve worked with freelancing platforms before, that’s not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we’ve created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they’ve ever been.

 

What are you hiring for right now?

  • We are hiring for PHP developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We’re also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

 

Will I get a job immediately after applying?

  • If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you’re qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we’ll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

 

What kind of opportunities do you provide?

  • We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you’ve performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

items.title: Front-end Web Developer
items.content:
Front-end Web Developer - Jobmote

Front-end Web Developer

Mutual

Mutual is looking for a full-time Craft CMS Front End Developer to join our agency.

This can be a remote position anywhere in the UK, or you can work from our office in Hastings, East Sussex.

About You

You’re competent and experienced with Craft, Twig, and HTML/CSS/JS. If you’re not experienced with Craft, you know the basics and can quickly adapt. You produce good quality code at a fast pace so that we can iterate quickly.

You’re wanting diversity in your work. One week you’ll be working with a large corporation, the next you’ll be helping a start-up.

You’ve got a keen eye for design. You can match and integrate designs closely, and run with them. 

You’re a manager of one. You can work in a team, and can take direction, but on a day-to-day basis you get your stuff done on time without needing somebody actively managing you.

You consider yourself a generalist. Where others focus on becoming the next top Laravel developer, you prefer to try lots of different things, Craft just so happens to be what you’re really good at right now.

You’re wanting more freedom in how you work. You’d like to work from home or an office of your choice, but are happy to occasionally spend a day or two in sunny Hastings to work on more hands-on stuff and to catch up.

You’re happy to maintain and grow existing websites as well as build new things.

About Us

We’re a small distributed team, with a main office in Hastings UK.

We provide each member of the team with an annual development budget to buy new equipment, go on courses, visit conferences, etc. We also provide other perks such as days out and time to develop side-projects.

2017 saw the team visit Portland and Seattle, and we’re planning team trips for 2018 right now.

Our client base is diverse and we have a number of exciting projects lined up for 2018.

We’re in such high demand as an agency we haven’t had a chance to finish our website. You can help change that!

items.title: SalesForce Full Stack Software Engineer Hire
items.content: Lenox Park Solutions is seeking a SalesForce Software Engineer with substantial experience developing custom, institutional software. As a full-time engineer, your focus would be working closely with our Development & Marketing staff to advance the functionality and scalability of customized Lightning Orgs. Initial day-to-day will include all aspects of managing the technical requirements of this product. The ideal candidate will also grow into a more senior leadership role in managing other outsourced development projects, and will have technical expertise beyond Force.com/Apex (PHP preferred) that will inform an expanded product suite. The candidate will have ample room to work on strategic development and technical efforts. At LPS, we focus on accountability, proactive-ness, and creative thinking. Staff members retain the option to work remotely, as we are a goals-oriented team.
